analyzed: jhāyati ākiñcañña āyatanam pi nissāya jhāyati nevasaññānāsaññāyatanam pi nissāya jhāyati  idha lokam pi nissāya jhāyati para lokam pi nissāya jhāyati yam pidam diṭṭham suta
translated: depending on the base of infinite space, depending on the base of infinite consciousness, depending on the base of nothingness, depending on the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception,

original: mutaṁ viññātaṁ pattaṁ pariyesitaṁ anuvicaritaṁ manasā, tampi nissāya jhāyati.
analyzed: mutam viññātam pattam pariyesitam anuvicaritam manasā tam pi nissāya jhāyati
translated: depending on this world, depending on the other world, depending on whatever is seen, heard, sensed, cognized, reached, sought after, and examined by the mind—he meditates depending on that.

original: Evaṁ kho, saddha, purisakhaḷuṅkajhāyitaṁ hoti.
analyzed: evam kho saddha purisa khaḷuṅka jhāyitam hoti
translated: That is how a man meditates like a wild colt.

original: Kathañca, saddha, ājānīyajhāyitaṁ hoti?
analyzed: kathañca saddhaḥ ājānīya jhāyitam ha uti
translated: And how does one meditate like a thoroughbred?

original: Bhadro hi, saddha, assājānīyo doṇiyā baddho na ‘yavasaṁ yavasan’ti jhāyati.
analyzed: bhadraḥ hi saddha assājānīyaḥ doṇiyā baddhaḥ na yavasam yavasanti jhāyati
translated: A fine thoroughbred horse, tethered in a manger, does not meditate like this: ‘Grazing, grazing!’

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: Bhadrassa hi, saddha, assājānīyassa doṇiyā baddhassa evaṁ hoti:
analyzed: bhadrassa hi saddha assa ajānīyassa doṇiyā baddhassa evam hoti
translated: Because a fine thoroughbred horse tethered in a manger thinks:

original: ‘kiṁ nu kho maṁ ajja assadammasārathi kāraṇaṁ kāressati, kimassāhaṁ paṭikaromī’ti.
analyzed: kim nu kho mama ajja assa damma sārathi kāraṇam kāressati kim assa aham paṭikaromi iti
translated: ‘What work will my master make me do today? What shall I do in return?’

original: So doṇiyā baddho na ‘yavasaṁ yavasan’ti jhāyati.🔽Bhadro hi, saddha, assājānīyo yathā iṇaṁ yathā bandhaṁ yathā jāniṁ yathā kaliṁ evaṁ patodassa ajjhoharaṇaṁ samanupassati.
analyzed: saḥ doṇiyā baddhaḥ na yavasam yavasanti jhāyati  bhadraḥ hi saddha assājānīyaḥ yathā iṇam yathā bandham yathā jānim yathā kalim evam patodassa ajjhoharaṇam samanupassati
translated: So tethered in a manger, it does not meditate like this: ‘Grazing, grazing!’🔽Because a fine thoroughbred horse regards the taking of food as a debt, as a sickness, as a calamity.

original: Evamevaṁ kho, saddha, bhadro purisājānīyo araññagatopi rukkhamūlagatopi suññāgāragatopi
analyzed: evam evam kho saddha bhadro purisājānīyaḥ arañña gataḥ api rukkha mūla gataḥ api suññāgāra gataḥ api
translated: In the same way, a fine thoroughbred man, gone to the forest, to the foot of a tree, or to an empty hut,

original: na kāmarāgapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati na kāmarāgaparetena, uppannassa ca kāmarāgassa
analyzed: na kāma rāga pariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati na kāma rāga paretena uppannassa ca kāma rāgassa
translated: does not live with a mind obsessed and enslaved by sensual lust, and he does not tolerate such a mind.

original: nissaraṇaṁ yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti,
analyzed: nissaraṇam yathābhūtam pajānāti
translated: he understands as it really is the escape from it,

original: na byāpādapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati …🔽na thinamiddhapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati …
analyzed: na byāpāda pariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati  na thinamiddha pariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati
translated: he does not dwell with a mind obsessed by ill will …🔽he does not dwell with a mind obsessed by stiffness and torpor …

original: na uddhaccakukkuccapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati …
analyzed: na uddhacca kukkucca pariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati
translated: he does not dwell with a mind obsessed by restlessness and remorse …

original: na vicikicchāpariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati na vicikicchāparetena, uppannāya ca vicikicchāya nissaraṇaṁ yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti.
analyzed: na vicikicchā pariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati na vicikicchā paretena uppannāya ca vicikicchāya nissaraṇam yathābhūtam pajānāti
translated: he does not dwell with a mind obsessed by doubt, uncertain and undecided, nor has he any doubt, uncertainty, or indecision about the escape from arisen bad unwholesome states,

original: So neva pathaviṁ nissāya jhāyati, na āpaṁ nissāya jhāyati, na tejaṁ nissāya jhāyati,🔽na vāyaṁ nissāya jhāyati, na ākāsānañcāyatanaṁ nissāya jhāyati, na viññāṇañcāyatanaṁ🔽nissāya jhāyati, na ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ nissāya jhāyati, na nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṁ
analyzed: so na iva pathavim nissāya jhāyati na āpam nissāya jhāyati na tejam nissāya jhāyati  na vā ayam nissāya jhāyati na ākāsānañcāyatanam nissāya jhāyati na viññāṇañcāyatana  nissāya jhāyati na ākiñcaññāyatanam nissāya jhāyati na nevasaññānāsaññāyatana
translated: he does not meditate depending on earth, he does not meditate depending on water, he does not meditate depending on fire,🔽he does not meditate depending on air, he does not meditate depending on the base of infinite space, he does not meditate depending on the base of infinite consciousness,🔽he does not meditate depending on the base of nothingness, he does not meditate depending on the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception,🔽he does not meditate depending on this world, he does not meditate depending on the other world,

original: nissāya jhāyati, na idhalokaṁ nissāya jhāyati, na paralokaṁ nissāya jhāyati, yampidaṁ
analyzed: nissāya jhāyati na idha lokam nissāya jhāyati na para lokam nissāya jhāyati yam pida
translated: he does not meditate depending on whatever is seen, heard, sensed, cognized, reached, sought after, examined by the mind.

original: diṭṭhaṁ sutaṁ mutaṁ viññātaṁ pattaṁ pariyesitaṁ anuvicaritaṁ manasā, tampi nissāya na jhāyati;
analyzed: diṭṭham sutam mutam viññātam pattam pariyesitam anuvicaritam manasā tam pi nissāya na jhāyati
translated: He doesn’t meditate depending on what is seen, heard, sensed, cognized, attained, sought after, pondered by the intellect, or measured by the mind.

original: jhāyati ca pana.
analyzed: jhāyati ca pana
translated: But he does meditate.🔽And the good person who meditates like this, the gods with Indra, with Brahmā, and with Pajāpati pay homage to him from afar,

original: Evaṁ jhāyiñca pana, saddha, bhadraṁ purisājānīyaṁ saindā devā sabrahmakā sapajāpatikā ārakāva namassanti:
analyzed: evam jhāyin ca pana saddha bhadram purisājānīyam saindāḥ devāḥ sa brahmakāḥ sa pajāpatikāḥ ārakā ava namassanti
translated: saying:

original: ‘Namo te purisājañña,
analyzed: namaḥ te purisa ajañña
translated: ‘Homage to you, O human being!

original: namo te purisuttama;
analyzed: namaḥ te purisuttama
translated: Homage to you, O best of humans!

original: Yassa te nābhijānāma,
analyzed: yaḥ sa te na abhijānāma
translated: We don’t know your name

original: yampi nissāya jhāyasī’”ti.
analyzed: yam pi nissāya jhāyasi iti
translated: or what you meditate depending on.’”

original: Evaṁ vutte, āyasmā saddho bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte āyasmā saddhaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, Ven. Saddha said to the Blessed One,

original: “kathaṁ jhāyī pana, bhante, bhadro purisājānīyo neva pathaviṁ nissāya jhāyati, na🔽āpaṁ nissāya jhāyati, na tejaṁ nissāya jhāyati, na vāyaṁ nissāya jhāyati, na ākāsānañcāyatanaṁ
analyzed: katham jhāyī pana bhante bhadro purisājānīyaḥ na iva pathavim nissāya jhāyati na  āpam nissāya jhāyati na tejam nissāya jhāyati na vāyam nissāya jhāyati na
translated: “But, lord, how does a good person who meditates not meditate depending on the earth,🔽not meditate depending on the water, not meditate depending on the fire, not meditate depending on the wind, not meditate depending on the base of infinite space,

original: nissāya jhāyati, na viññāṇañcāyatanaṁ nissāya jhāyati, na ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ nissāya
analyzed: nissāya jhāyati na viññāṇañcāyatanam nissāya jhāyati na ākiñcaññāyatanam nissāya
translated: not meditate depending on the base of infinite consciousness, not meditate depending on the base of nothingness,

original: jhāyati, na nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṁ nissāya jhāyati, na idhalokaṁ nissāya jhāyati,
analyzed: jhāyati na nevasaññānāsaññāyatanam nissāya jhāyati na idhalokam nissāya jhāyati
translated: He does not meditate dependent on the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception. He does not meditate dependent on this world.

original: na paralokaṁ nissāya jhāyati, yampidaṁ diṭṭhaṁ sutaṁ mutaṁ viññātaṁ pattaṁ pariyesitaṁ
analyzed: na para lokam nissāya jhāyati yam pi idam diṭṭham sutam mutam viññātam pattam
translated: He does not meditate dependent on the next world. He does not meditate dependent on what is seen, heard, or sensed.

original: anuvicaritaṁ manasā, tampi nissāya na jhāyati;
analyzed: anuvicaritam manasā nissāya na jhāyati
translated: He does not meditate dependent on what is attained, sought, or pondered by the mind.

original: jhāyati ca pana?
analyzed: jhāyati ca pana
translated: But he does meditate.🔽And how does a good horse, a thoroughbred, meditate?🔽The gods with Indra, with Brahmā, and with Pajāpati

original: Kathaṁ jhāyiñca pana, bhante, bhadraṁ purisājānīyaṁ saindā devā sabrahmakā sapajāpatikā ārakāva namassanti:
analyzed: katham jhāyin ca pana bhante bhadram purisājānīyam saindāḥ devāḥ sa brahmakāḥ sa pajāpatikāḥ ārakā ava namassanti
translated: pay homage from afar, saying:

original: ‘Namo te purisājañña,
analyzed: namaḥ te purisa ajañña
translated: ‘Homage to you, thoroughbred man!

original: namo te purisuttama;
analyzed: namaḥ te purisuttama
translated: Homage to you, supreme among men!

original: Yassa te nābhijānāma,
analyzed: yaḥ sa te na abhijānāma
translated: We do not know your support,

original: yampi nissāya jhāyasī’”ti.
analyzed: yam pi nissāya jhāyasi iti
translated: on which you meditate.’

original: “Idha, saddha, bhadrassa purisājānīyassa pathaviyaṁ pathavisaññā vibhūtā hoti, āpasmiṁ
analyzed: idha saddha bhadrassa purisājānīyassa pathaviyam pathavi saññā vibhūtā hoti āpasmi
translated: “Here, faithful one, the good horse, the thoroughbred, has completely transcended perceptions of form,

original: āposaññā vibhūtā hoti, tejasmiṁ tejosaññā vibhūtā hoti, vāyasmiṁ vāyosaññā vibhūtā
analyzed: āpo saññā vibhūtā hoti tejasmim tejaḥ saññā vibhūtā hoti vāyasmim vāyo saññā vibhūtā
translated: perceptions of the base of infinite space is completely transcended, the perception of the base of infinite consciousness is completely transcended, the perception of the base of nothingness is completely transcended,

original: hoti, ākāsānañcāyatane ākāsānañcāyatanasaññā vibhūtā hoti, viññāṇañcāyatane viññāṇañcāyatanasaññā🔽vibhūtā hoti, ākiñcaññāyatane ākiñcaññāyatanasaññā vibhūtā hoti, nevasaññānāsaññāyatane🔽nevasaññānāsaññāyatanasaññā vibhūtā hoti, idhaloke idhalokasaññā vibhūtā hoti, paraloke
analyzed: hoti ākāsānañcāyatane ākāsānañcāyatana saññā vibhūtā hoti viññāṇañcāyatane viññāṇañcāyatana saññā  vibhūtā hoti ākiñcaññāyatane ākiñcaññāyatana saññā vibhūtā hoti na ivasaññā nāsaññāyatane  nevasaññā nāsañña āyatana saññā vibhūtā hoti idha loke idha loka saññā vibhūtā hoti para loke
translated: In the base of infinite consciousness, perceptions of the base of infinite space have been abandoned and perceptions of the base of infinite consciousness prevail.🔽In the base of nothingness, perceptions of the base of infinite consciousness have been abandoned and perceptions of the base of nothingness prevail.🔽In the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, perceptions of the base of nothingness have been abandoned and perceptions of the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception prevail.

original: paralokasaññā vibhūtā hoti, yampidaṁ diṭṭhaṁ sutaṁ mutaṁ viññātaṁ pattaṁ pariyesitaṁ
analyzed: para loka saññā vibhūtā hoti yat pi idam diṭṭham sutam mutam viññātam pattam
translated: In this world, perceptions of this world have been abandoned and perceptions of the other world prevail.

original: anuvicaritaṁ manasā, tatrāpi saññā vibhūtā hoti.🔽Evaṁ jhāyī kho, saddha, bhadro purisājānīyo neva pathaviṁ nissāya jhāyati …pe…🔽yampidaṁ diṭṭhaṁ sutaṁ mutaṁ viññātaṁ pattaṁ pariyesitaṁ anuvicaritaṁ manasā, tampi nissāya na jhāyati;
analyzed: anuvicaritam manasā tatra api saññā vibhūtā hoti  evam jhāyī kho saddha bhadro purisājānīyaḥ na iva pathavim nissāya jhāyati pe  yam pi idam diṭṭham sutam mutam viññātam pattam pariyesitam anuvicaritam manasā tam pi nissāya na jhāyati
translated: In the other world, perceptions of the other world have been abandoned and perceptions of this world prevail.🔽In what is seen, heard, sensed, cognized, attained, sought after, pondered by the intellect, even that has been abandoned, discarded, rejected, relinquished, let go, not clung to.🔽Such is the meditator, the good person, the thoroughbred person, the person who has entered the fold, the person who has reached the system, the person who has attained the doctrine, the person who has understood the Teacher’s Dispensation.

original: jhāyati ca pana.
analyzed: jhāyati ca pana
translated: He does not meditate depending on earth, water, fire, or air;🔽he does not meditate depending on the base of infinite space, the base of infinite consciousness, the base of nothingness, or the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception;🔽he does not meditate depending on this world or the next world,🔽he does not meditate depending on what is seen, heard, sensed, cognized, attained, sought after, pondered by the intellect, or discovered.

original: Evaṁ jhāyiñca pana, saddha, bhadraṁ purisājānīyaṁ saindā devā sabrahmakā sapajāpatikā ārakāva namassanti:
analyzed: evam jhāyin ca pana saddha bhadram purisājānīyam saindāḥ devāḥ sa brahmakāḥ sa pajāpatikāḥ ārakā ava namassanti
translated: And, faithful one, the gods with Indra, with Brahma, and with Pajapati revere from afar that good person, that thoroughbred person who is a meditator:

original: ‘Namo te purisājañña,
analyzed: namaḥ te purisa ajañña
translated: ‘We pay homage to you, thoroughbred person!

original: namo te purisuttama;
analyzed: namaḥ te purisuttama
translated: We pay homage to you, best of men!

original: Yassa te nābhijānāma,
analyzed: yaḥ sa te na abhijānāma
translated: We do not know your equal

original: yampi nissāya jhāyasī’”ti.🔽Navamaṁ.
analyzed: yam pi nissāya jhāyasi iti  navama
translated: in whom you take your stand to meditate.’🔽The ninth section on the thoroughbred person.

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 11.10
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The Book of the Tens

original: 1. Nissayavagga
analyzed: nissaya vagga
translated: The Chapter on Dependence

original: Moranivāpasutta
analyzed: mora nivāpa sutta
translated: At the Sīta Grove

original: Ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā rājagahe viharati moranivāpe paribbājakārāme.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā rājagahe viharati moranivāpe paribbājaka ārāme
translated: One time, the Blessed One was dwelling at Rājagaha in the Sīta Grove, in the deer park.

original: Tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi:
analyzed: tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: There the Blessed One addressed the monks:

original: “bhikkhavo”ti.
analyzed: bhikkhavaḥ ti
translated: “Monks!”

original: “Bhadante”ti te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṁ.
analyzed: bhadanta iti te bhikkhū bhagavataḥ
translated: “Venerable sir!” those monks replied.

original: Bhagavā etadavoca:
analyzed: bhagavān etat avoca
translated: The Blessed One said this:

original: “Tīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu accantaniṭṭho hoti accantayogakkhemī accantabrahmacārī accantapariyosāno seṭṭho devamanussānaṁ.
analyzed: tīhi bhikkhave dhammehi samannāgataḥ bhikkhu accanta niṭṭhaḥ hoti accanta yogakkhemī accanta brahmacārī accanta pariyosānaḥ seṭṭhaḥ deva manussāna
translated: “Monks, a monk endowed with three qualities is one who has attained the ultimate end, the ultimate security from bondage, the ultimate holy life, the ultimate goal, a leader of the holy life, a superlative person.

original: Katamehi tīhi?
analyzed: katamehi tīhi
translated: What are the three?

original: Asekhena sīlakkhandhena, asekhena samādhikkhandhena, asekhena paññākkhandhena—
analyzed: asekhena sīla kkhandhena asekhena samādhi kkhandhena asekhena paññā kkhandhena
translated: The aggregate of virtue of one beyond training, the aggregate of concentration of one beyond training, the aggregate of wisdom of one beyond training—

original: imehi, kho, bhikkhave, tīhi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu accantaniṭṭho hoti accantayogakkhemī accantabrahmacārī accantapariyosāno seṭṭho devamanussānaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi dhammehi samannāgataḥ bhikkhu accanta niṭṭhaḥ hoti accanta yogakkhemī accanta brahmacārī accanta pariyosānaḥ seṭṭhaḥ deva manussāna
translated: A monk with these three qualities is one who has finished with paying attention to the training.”

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu accantaniṭṭho hoti accantayogakkhemī accantabrahmacārī accantapariyosāno seṭṭho devamanussānaṁ.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave tīhi dhammehi samannāgataḥ bhikkhu accanta niṭṭhaḥ hoti accanta yogakkhemī accanta brahmacārī accanta pariyosānaḥ seṭṭhaḥ deva manussāna
translated: “Monks, when a monk has three qualities, he is one who has finished with paying attention to the training.

original: Katamehi tīhi?
analyzed: katamehi tīhi
translated: What are the three?

original: Iddhipāṭihāriyena, ādesanāpāṭihāriyena, anusāsanīpāṭihāriyena—🔽imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu accantaniṭṭho hoti, accantayogakkhemī accantabrahmacārī accantapariyosāno seṭṭho devamanussānaṁ.
analyzed: iddhi pāṭihāriyena ādesanā pāṭihāriyena anusāsanī pāṭihāriyena  imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi dhammehi samannāgataḥ bhikkhu accanta niṭṭhaḥ hoti accanta yogakkhemī accanta brahmacārī accanta pariyosānaḥ seṭṭhaḥ deva manussāna
translated: The miracle of psychic power, the miracle of telepathy, and the miracle of instruction.🔽A monk with these three qualities is one who has finished with paying attention to the training.”

original: Aparehipi, bhikkhave, tīhi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu accantaniṭṭho hoti accantayogakkhemī accantabrahmacārī accantapariyosāno seṭṭho devamanussānaṁ.
analyzed: aparehi pi bhikkhave tīhi dhammehi samannāgataḥ bhikkhu accanta niṭṭhaḥ hoti accanta yogakkhemī accanta brahmacārī accanta pariyosānaḥ seṭṭhaḥ deva manussāna
translated: “Monks, when a monk has three further qualities, he is one who has finished with paying attention to the training.

original: Katamehi tīhi?
analyzed: katamehi tīhi
translated: What are the three?

original: Sammādiṭṭhiyā, sammāñāṇena, sammāvimuttiyā—
analyzed: sammā diṭṭhiyā sammā ñāṇena sammā vimuttiyā
translated: Right view, right knowledge, and right freedom.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu accantaniṭṭho hoti accantayogakkhemī accantabrahmacārī accantapariyosāno seṭṭho devamanussānaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave tīhi dhammehi samannāgataḥ bhikkhu accanta niṭṭhaḥ hoti accanta yogakkhemī accanta brahmacārī accanta pariyosānaḥ seṭṭhaḥ deva manussāna
translated: A monk who has these three qualities has reached the ultimate end, the ultimate security from bondage, the ultimate holy life, the ultimate goal, and is best among gods and humans.

original: Dvīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu accantaniṭṭho hoti accantayogakkhemī accantabrahmacārī accantapariyosāno seṭṭho devamanussānaṁ.
analyzed: dvīhi bhikkhave dhammehi samannāgataḥ bhikkhu accanta niṭṭhaḥ hoti accanta yogakkhemī accanta brahmacārī accanta pariyosānaḥ seṭṭhaḥ deva manussāna
translated: A monk who has two qualities has reached the ultimate end, the ultimate security from bondage, the ultimate holy life, the ultimate goal, and is best among gods and humans.

original: Katamehi dvīhi?
analyzed: katamehi dvīhi
translated: What are the two?

original: Vijjāya, caraṇena—
analyzed: vijjāya caraṇena
translated: Knowledge and conduct.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, dvīhi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu accantaniṭṭho hoti accantayogakkhemī accantabrahmacārī accantapariyosāno seṭṭho devamanussānaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave dvīhi dhammehi samannāgataḥ bhikkhu accanta niṭṭhaḥ hoti accanta yogakkhemī accanta brahmacārī accanta pariyosānaḥ seṭṭhaḥ deva manussāna
translated: A monk who has these two qualities has reached the ultimate end, the ultimate security from bondage, the ultimate holy life, the ultimate goal, and is best among gods and humans.

original: Brahmunā pesā, bhikkhave, sanaṅkumārena gāthā bhāsitā:
analyzed: brahmunā pesā bhikkhave sanaṅkumārena gāthā bhāsitā
translated: This verse was sung by the Brahmā Sanaṅkumāra:

original: ‘Khattiyo seṭṭho janetasmiṁ,
analyzed: khattiyaḥ seṭṭhaḥ janetasmi
translated: ‘The noble are the best among people,

original: ye gottapaṭisārino;🔽Vijjācaraṇasampanno,
analyzed: ye gotta paṭisārino  vijjā ācaraṇa sampannaḥ
translated: those who are mindful of their lineage.🔽But the best among gods and humans

original: so seṭṭho devamānuse’ti.
analyzed: so seṭṭhaḥ deva mānusa iti
translated: is the one with knowledge and conduct.’

original: Sā kho panesā, bhikkhave, sanaṅkumārena gāthā bhāsitā subhāsitā, no dubbhāsitā; atthasaṁhitā, no anatthasaṁhitā; anumatā mayā.
analyzed: sā kho pana isā bhikkhave sanaṅkumārena gāthā bhāsitā su bhāsitā no dubbhāsitā attha sahitā no anattha sahitā anumatā mayā
translated: But the verse spoken by Sanaṅkumāra was well spoken, not ill spoken. It was beneficial, not unbeneficial. And I agree with it.

original: Ahampi, bhikkhave, evaṁ vadāmi:
analyzed: aham pi bhikkhave evam vadāmi
translated: I also say this:

original: ‘Khattiyo seṭṭho janetasmiṁ,
analyzed: khattiyaḥ seṭṭhaḥ janetasmi
translated: ‘The noble are the best among the people

original: ye gottapaṭisārino;
analyzed: ye gotta paṭisārino
translated: who trace their lineage back through ten generations.

original: Vijjācaraṇasampanno,
analyzed: vijjā ācaraṇa sampannaḥ
translated: But the one endowed with knowledge and conduct

original: so seṭṭho devamānuse’”ti.
analyzed: so seṭṭhaḥ deva mānusa iti
translated: is the best among gods and humans.’

original: Dasamaṁ.🔽Nissayavaggo paṭhamo.
analyzed: dasama  nissaya vaggaḥ paṭhamaḥ
translated: The tenth.

original: Tassuddānaṁ
analyzed: tassa uddāna
translated: The first sub-chapter on dependence is finished.🔽The summary:

original: Kimatthiyā cetanā tayo,
analyzed: kimatthiyā cetanā tayo
translated: What’s the purpose of intention? Three,

original: upanisā byasanena ca;
analyzed: upanisā byasanena ca
translated: and with misfortune.

original: Dve saññā manasikāro,
analyzed: dve saññā manasikāro
translated: Two perceptions, and attention,

original: saddho moranivāpakanti.
analyzed: saddhaḥ
translated: and the faith of the peacock’s cry.

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 11.11
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The Numerical Discourses of the Buddha 1.1

original: 2. Anussativagga
analyzed: anussati vagga
translated: The Chapter on Recollection

original: Paṭhamamahānāmasutta
analyzed: paṭhama mahānāma sutta
translated: With Mahānāma (1)

original: Ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sakkesu viharati kapilavatthusmiṁ nigrodhārāme.🔽Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū bhagavato cīvarakammaṁ karonti:
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā sakkesu viharati kapilavatthusmin nigrodha ārāme  tena kho pana samayena sambahulāḥ bhikkhū bhagavataḥ cīvara kammam karonti
translated: One time, the Blessed One was staying in the Sakyan country in the Banyan Tree Monastery at Kapilavatthu.

original: “niṭṭhitacīvaro bhagavā temāsaccayena cārikaṁ pakkamissatī”ti.
analyzed: niṭṭhita cīvaraḥ bhagavā te māsa cayena cārikam pakkamissati iti
translated: And on that occasion many monks were making robes for the Blessed One, thinking, “When the Blessed One’s robes are finished, after staying in the wilderness for three months, he will set out on tour.”

original: Assosi kho mahānāmo sakko:
analyzed: assosi kho mahānāmaḥ sakko
translated: Mahānāma the Sakyan heard that

original: “sambahulā kira bhikkhū bhagavato cīvarakammaṁ karonti:
analyzed: sambahulā kira bhikkhū bhagavataḥ cīvara kammam karonti
translated: “A number of monks are making a robe for the Buddha,

original: ‘niṭṭhitacīvaro bhagavā temāsaccayena cārikaṁ pakkamissatī’”ti.
analyzed: niṭṭhita cīvaraḥ bhagavā te māsa cayena cārikam pakkamissati iti
translated: thinking that when his robe is finished, after staying near Rājagaha for the three months of the Rains, he will set out wandering.”

original: Atha kho mahānāmo sakko yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho mahānāmo sakko bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu mahānāmaḥ sakkaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ khalu mahānāmaḥ sakkaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: Mahānāma then went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

original: “sutaṁ metaṁ, bhante:
analyzed: sutam mā ita bhante
translated: and said, “Sir, I heard

original: ‘sambahulā kira bhikkhū bhagavato cīvarakammaṁ karonti—
analyzed: sambahulā kira bhikkhū bhagavataḥ cīvara kammam karonti
translated: that a number of monks are making a robe for the Buddha,

original: niṭṭhitacīvaro bhagavā temāsaccayena cārikaṁ pakkamissatī’ti.
analyzed: niṭṭhita cīvaraḥ bhagavā te māsa cayena cārikam pakkamissati iti
translated: thinking that when his robe is finished, after staying near Rājagaha for the three months of the Rains, he will set out wandering.

original: Tesaṁ no, bhante, nānāvihārehi viharataṁ kenassa vihārena vihātabban”ti?
analyzed: tesam naḥ bhante nānā vihārehi viharatam kenassa vihārena vihātabbanti
translated: But we live in different dwellings. Which dwelling should we use?”

original: “Sādhu sādhu, mahānāma.
analyzed: sādhu sādhu mahānāma
translated: “Good, good, Mahānāma!

original: Etaṁ kho, mahānāma, tumhākaṁ patirūpaṁ kulaputtānaṁ, yaṁ tumhe tathāgataṁ upasaṅkamitvā puccheyyātha:
analyzed: etam khalu mahānāma tumhākam pati rūpam kula puttāna yam tumhe tathāgatam upasaṅkamitvā puccheyyātha
translated: It’s proper for you gentlemen to come to the Buddha and ask this.

original: ‘tesaṁ no, bhante, nānāvihārehi viharataṁ kenassa vihārena vihātabban’ti?
analyzed: tesam naḥ bhante nānā vihārehi viharatam kenassa vihārena vihātabbanti
translated: ‘Venerable Sir, we live in different dwellings. Which dwelling should we live in?’

original: Saddho kho, mahānāma, ārādhako hoti, no assaddho;
analyzed: saddhaḥ kho mahānāma ārādhakaḥ hoti no assaddhaḥ
translated: Mahanama, a faithful person succeeds, not an unfaithful one.

original: āraddhavīriyo ārādhako hoti, no kusīto;🔽upaṭṭhitassati ārādhako hoti, no muṭṭhassati;
analyzed: āraddha vīriyaḥ ārādhako hoti no kusīto  upaṭṭhitassati ārādhakaḥ hoti no muṭṭhassati
translated: An energetic person succeeds, not a lazy one.🔽A mindful person succeeds, not an unmindful one.

original: samāhito ārādhako hoti, no asamāhito;
analyzed: samāhitaḥ ārādhakaḥ hoti no a samāhitaḥ
translated: A concentrated person succeeds, not one who lacks concentration.

original: paññavā ārādhako hoti, no duppañño.
analyzed: paññavā ārādhakaḥ hoti no duppaññaḥ
translated: A wise person succeeds, not a witless one.

original: Imesu kho tvaṁ, mahānāma, pañcasu dhammesu patiṭṭhāya cha dhamme uttari bhāveyyāsi.
analyzed: imesu kho tva mahānāma pañcasu dhammesu patiṭṭhāya cha dhamme uttari bhāveyyāsi
translated: Mahanama, having established yourself in these five qualities, you should develop a further six qualities.

original: Idha tvaṁ, mahānāma, tathāgataṁ anussareyyāsi:
analyzed: idha tva mahānāma tathāgatam anussareyyāsi
translated: Here, Mahanama, you should recollect the Tathagata thus:

original: ‘itipi so bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṁ buddho bhagavā’ti.
analyzed: iti pi saḥ bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ vijjā caraṇa sampanno sugataḥ loka vidū anuttaraḥ purisa damma sārathi satthā deva manussānam buddhaḥ bhagavā ati
translated: ‘The Blessed One is an Arahant, a Perfectly Enlightened One, perfect in knowledge and conduct, a Sugata, an knower of the world, an unsurpassed trainer of those who can be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, a Blessed One.’

original: Yasmiṁ, mahānāma, samaye ariyasāvako tathāgataṁ anussarati, nevassa tasmiṁ samaye rāgapariyuṭṭhitaṁ cittaṁ hoti, na dosapariyuṭṭhitaṁ cittaṁ hoti, na mohapariyuṭṭhitaṁ cittaṁ hoti;
analyzed: yasmi mahānāma samaye ariya sāvakaḥ tathāgatam anussarati na iva assa tasmin samaye rāga pariyuṭṭhitam cittam hoti na dosa pariyuṭṭhitam cittam hoti na moha pariyuṭṭhitam cittam hoti
translated: When a noble disciple recollects the Tathagata, on that occasion his mind is not obsessed by lust, hatred, or delusion;

original: ujugatamevassa tasmiṁ samaye cittaṁ hoti tathāgataṁ ārabbha.🔽Ujugatacitto kho pana, mahānāma, ariyasāvako labhati atthavedaṁ, labhati dhammavedaṁ, labhati dhammūpasaṁhitaṁ pāmojjaṁ.🔽Pamuditassa pīti jāyati, pītimanassa kāyo passambhati, passaddhakāyo sukhaṁ vediyati, sukhino cittaṁ samādhiyati.
analyzed: uju gatam eva assa tasmin samaye cittam hoti tathāgatam ārabbha  ujugatacittaḥ kho pana mahā nāma ariya sāvakaḥ labhati attha veda labhati dhamma veda labhati dhamma upasahitam pāmojja  pamuditassa pīti jāyati pīti manassa kāyo passambhati passaddha kāyo sukham vediyati sukhinaḥ cittam samādhiyati
translated: on that occasion his mind is simply straight.🔽When the mind is straight, the noble disciple gains a sense of urgency about unarisen unwholesome states …

original: Ayaṁ vuccati, mahānāma, ariyasāvako visamagatāya pajāya samappatto viharati, sabyāpajjāya pajāya abyāpajjo viharati, dhammasotasamāpanno buddhānussatiṁ bhāveti.
analyzed: ayam vuccati mahānāma ariya sāvako visama gatāya pajāya samappattaḥ viharati sa byāpajjāya pajāya a byāpajjaḥ viharati dhamma sota samāpannaḥ buddha anussatim bhāveti
translated: and attains the ability to enter upon and abide in the signless concentration of mind.🔽This, great man, is called a noble disciple who, with the destruction of the five lower fetters, is due to reappear spontaneously in the Pure Abodes and there attain final Nibbana, without ever returning from that world.

original: Puna caparaṁ tvaṁ, mahānāma, dhammaṁ anussareyyāsi:
analyzed: puna caparam tva mahānāma dhammaṃ anussareyyāsi
translated: Again, great man, you should recollect the Dhamma:

original: ‘svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo sandiṭṭhiko akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṁ veditabbo viññūhī’ti.
analyzed: su ākkhātaḥ bhagavatā dhammaḥ sandiṭṭhikaḥ akālikaḥ ehipassikaḥ opaneyyikaḥ paccattam veditabbaḥ viññūhi iti
translated: ‘The Dhamma is well-expounded by the Lord, to be seen here and now, timeless, inviting inspection, leading onward, to be experienced individually by the wise.’

original: Yasmiṁ, mahānāma, samaye ariyasāvako dhammaṁ anussarati, nevassa tasmiṁ samaye rāgapariyuṭṭhitaṁ cittaṁ hoti, na dosapariyuṭṭhitaṁ cittaṁ hoti, na mohapariyuṭṭhitaṁ cittaṁ hoti;
analyzed: yasmi mahānāma samaye ariya sāvakaḥ dhammaṃ anussarati na iva assa tasmin samaye rāga pariyuṭṭhitam cittam hoti na dosa pariyuṭṭhitam cittam hoti na moha pariyuṭṭhitam cittam hoti
translated: “When a noble disciple recollects the Dhamma, on that occasion his mind is not obsessed by lust, hatred or delusion;

original: ujugatamevassa tasmiṁ samaye cittaṁ hoti dhammaṁ ārabbha.🔽Ujugatacitto kho pana, mahānāma, ariyasāvako labhati atthavedaṁ, labhati dhammavedaṁ, labhati dhammūpasaṁhitaṁ pāmojjaṁ.
analyzed: uju gatam eva assa tasmin samaye cittam hoti dhammam ārabbha  ujugatacittaḥ kho pana mahā nāma ariya sāvakaḥ labhati attha veda labhati dhamma veda labhati dhamma upasahitam pāmojja
translated: on that occasion his mind is simply straight, based on the Dhamma.🔽And when the mind is straight, the noble disciple obtains conviction;

original: Pamuditassa pīti jāyati, pītimanassa kāyo passambhati, passaddhakāyo sukhaṁ vediyati, sukhino cittaṁ samādhiyati.
analyzed: pamuditassa pīti jāyati pīti manassa kāyo passambhati passaddha kāyo sukham vediyati sukhinaḥ cittam samādhiyati
translated: when he is convinced, gladness arises; when the mind is gladdened, the body becomes tranquil; one tranquil in body feels pleasure; and when pleased in mind, the mind becomes concentrated.

original: Ayaṁ vuccati, mahānāma, ariyasāvako visamagatāya pajāya samappatto viharati, sabyāpajjāya pajāya abyāpajjo viharati, dhammasotasamāpanno dhammānussatiṁ bhāveti.
analyzed: ayam vuccati mahānāma ariya sāvakaḥ visama gatāya pajāya samappattaḥ viharati sa byāpajjāya pajāya a byāpajjaḥ viharati dhamma sota samāpannaḥ dhamma anussatim bhāveti
translated: This is called a noble disciple who, with the destruction of the five lower fetters, is due to reappear spontaneously in the Pure Abodes and there attain final Nibbana, without ever returning from that world.

original: Puna caparaṁ tvaṁ, mahānāma, saṅghaṁ anussareyyāsi:🔽‘suppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, ujuppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, ñāyappaṭipanno🔽bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, sāmīcippaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, yadidaṁ cattāri🔽purisayugāni aṭṭha purisapuggalā, esa bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho āhuneyyo pāhuneyyo dakkhiṇeyyo
analyzed: puna caparam tva mahā nāma saṅgham anussareyyāsi  suppaṭipannaḥ bhagavataḥ sāvaka saṅghaḥ uju ppaṭipannaḥ bhagavataḥ sāvaka saṅghaḥ ñāya ppaṭipannaḥ  bhagavato sāvaka saṅgho sāmīcippaṭipannaḥ bhagavato sāvaka saṅghaḥ yat idam cattāri  purisa yugāni aṭṭha purisa puggalā esa bhagavato sāvaka saṅghaḥ āhuneyyaḥ pāhuneyyaḥ dakkhiṇeyyaḥ
translated: “Again, Mahanama, you should recollect the Sangha thus:

original: añjalikaraṇīyo anuttaraṁ puññakkhettaṁ lokassā’ti.
analyzed: añjali karaṇīyaḥ anuttaram puñña kkhettam lokassa ati
translated: ‘The Sangha of the Blessed One’s disciples is practicing the good way, practicing the straight way, practicing the true way, practicing the proper way; that is, the four pairs of persons, the eight types of individuals—this Sangha of the Blessed One’s disciples is worthy of gifts, worthy of hospitality, worthy of offerings, worthy of reverential salutation, the unsurpassed field of merit for the world.’

original: Yasmiṁ, mahānāma, samaye ariyasāvako saṅghaṁ anussarati, nevassa tasmiṁ samaye rāgapariyuṭṭhitaṁ cittaṁ hoti, na dosapariyuṭṭhitaṁ cittaṁ hoti, na mohapariyuṭṭhitaṁ cittaṁ hoti;
analyzed: yasmi mahānāma samaye ariya sāvakaḥ saṅgham anussarati na iva assa tasmin samaye rāga pariyuṭṭhitam cittam hoti na dosa pariyuṭṭhitam cittam hoti na moha pariyuṭṭhitam cittam hoti
translated: “Mahanama, when a noble disciple recollects the Sangha, on that occasion his mind is not obsessed by lust, hatred, or delusion;

original: ujugatamevassa tasmiṁ samaye cittaṁ hoti saṅghaṁ ārabbha.
analyzed: uju gatam eva assa tasmin samaye cittam hoti saṅgham ārabbha
translated: on that occasion his mind is simply straight.

original: Ujugatacitto kho pana, mahānāma, ariyasāvako labhati atthavedaṁ, labhati dhammavedaṁ, labhati dhammūpasaṁhitaṁ pāmojjaṁ.
analyzed: ujugatacittaḥ kho pana mahā nāma ariya sāvakaḥ labhati attha veda labhati dhamma veda labhati dhamma upasahitam pāmojja
translated: When the mind is straight, the noble disciple has a sense of the proper limitation in regard to himself.

original: Pamuditassa pīti jāyati, pītimanassa kāyo passambhati, passaddhakāyo sukhaṁ vediyati, sukhino cittaṁ samādhiyati.
analyzed: pamuditassa pīti jāyati pīti manassa kāyo passambhati passaddha kāyo sukham vediyati sukhinaḥ cittam samādhiyati
translated: When he is thus mindful, joy arises in him, and when the mind is joyful, the body becomes tranquil. One tranquil in body experiences happiness, and the mind of one who is happy becomes concentrated.

original: Ayaṁ vuccati, mahānāma, ariyasāvako visamagatāya pajāya samappatto viharati, sabyāpajjāya pajāya abyāpajjo viharati, dhammasotasamāpanno saṅghānussatiṁ bhāveti.
analyzed: ayam vuccati mahānāma ariya sāvako visama gatāya pajāya samappattaḥ viharati sa byāpajjāya pajāya a byāpajjaḥ viharati dhamma sota samāpanno saṅgha anussatim bhāveti
translated: This, Mahanama, is called a noble disciple who dwells in balance amid an unbalanced population, who dwells unafflicted amid an afflicted population. He attains internal tranquillity of mind. He has planted the spiritual faculties in himself. He cultivates the spiritual faculties in himself. He has entered the path of direct knowledge. He has entered the path of direct knowing. He has entered the path of right view. He has entered the path of right seeing. He has entered the path of the true dhamma. He has entered the path of the noble ones. He has entered the direct path to convergence. He has entered the direct path to enlightenment. He has entered the direct path to penetration. He has entered the path that leads to the right way. He has entered the path that leads to nibbana. He has entered the path that leads to the deathless. He has entered the path that leads to the unborn. He has entered the path that leads to the unformed. He has entered the path that leads to security. He has entered the path that leads to nibbana.”

original: Puna caparaṁ tvaṁ, mahānāma, attano sīlāni anussareyyāsi akhaṇḍāni acchiddāni asabalāni akammāsāni bhujissāni viññuppasatthāni aparāmaṭṭhāni samādhisaṁvattanikāni.
analyzed: puna caparam tva mahānāma attano sīlāni anussareyyāsi akhaṇḍāni acchiddāni a sabalāni a kammāsāni bhujissāni viññu pasatthāni a parāmaṭṭhāni samādhi savattanikāni
translated: “Again, Mahanama, you should recollect the virtues of the Tathagata thus: ‘The Blessed One is an arahant, perfectly enlightened, accomplished in true knowledge and conduct, fortunate, knower of the world, unsurpassed trainer of persons to be tamed, teacher of devas and humans, the Enlightened One, the Blessed One.’

original: Yasmiṁ, mahānāma, samaye ariyasāvako sīlaṁ anussarati, nevassa tasmiṁ samaye rāgapariyuṭṭhitaṁ cittaṁ hoti, na dosapariyuṭṭhitaṁ cittaṁ hoti, na mohapariyuṭṭhitaṁ cittaṁ hoti;
analyzed: yasmi mahānāma samaye ariya sāvakaḥ sīlam anussarati na iva assa tasmin samaye rāga pariyuṭṭhitam cittam hoti na dosa pariyuṭṭhitam cittam hoti na moha pariyuṭṭhitam cittam hoti
translated: “When a noble disciple recollects the virtues of the Tathagata, on that occasion his mind is not obsessed by lust, hatred, or delusion;

original: ujugatamevassa tasmiṁ samaye cittaṁ hoti sīlaṁ ārabbha.🔽Ujugatacitto kho pana, mahānāma, ariyasāvako labhati atthavedaṁ, labhati dhammavedaṁ, labhati dhammūpasaṁhitaṁ pāmojjaṁ.
analyzed: uju gatam eva assa tasmin samaye cittam hoti sīlam ārabbha  ujugatacittaḥ kho pana mahā nāma ariya sāvakaḥ labhati attha veda labhati dhamma veda labhati dhamma upasahitam pāmojja
translated: on that occasion his mind is simply straight, based on the Tathagata.🔽“When a noble disciple’s mind is straight, based on the Tathagata, then, there being a suitable basis, he is capable of realizing the fruit of true knowledge and liberation, and he is capable of attaining the unsurpassed security from bondage.

original: Pamuditassa pīti jāyati, pītimanassa kāyo passambhati, passaddhakāyo sukhaṁ vediyati, sukhino cittaṁ samādhiyati.
analyzed: pamuditassa pīti jāyati pīti manassa kāyo passambhati passaddha kāyo sukham vediyati sukhinaḥ cittam samādhiyati
translated: “Again, Mahanama, you should recollect the Sangha of the Blessed One’s disciples thus: ‘The Sangha of the Blessed One’s disciples is practicing the good way…the straight way…the true way…the proper way, that is, the four pairs of persons, the eight types of individuals; this Sangha of the Blessed One’s disciples is worthy of gifts, worthy of hospitality, worthy of offerings, worthy of reverential salutation, the unsurpassed field of merit for the world.’🔽“When a noble disciple recollects the Sangha, on that occasion his mind is not obsessed by lust, hatred, or delusion;

original: Ayaṁ vuccati, mahānāma, ariyasāvako visamagatāya pajāya samappatto viharati, sabyāpajjāya pajāya abyāpajjo viharati, dhammasotasamāpanno sīlānussatiṁ bhāveti.
analyzed: ayam vuccati mahānāma ariya sāvako visama gatāya pajāya samappattaḥ viharati sa byāpajjāya pajāya a byāpajjaḥ viharati dhamma sota samāpannaḥ sīla anussatim bhāveti
translated: This is called a noble disciple who, with the destruction of the five lower fetters, is due to reappear spontaneously in the Pure Abodes and there attain final Nibbana, without ever returning from that world.

original: Puna caparaṁ tvaṁ, mahānāma, attano cāgaṁ anussareyyāsi:🔽‘lābhā vata me, suladdhaṁ vata me,
analyzed: puna caparam tva mahānāma attano cāgam anussareyyāsi  lābhāḥ vata me su laddham vata me
translated: “Again, Mahanama, you should recollect the generosity of the noble ones:

original: yohaṁ maccheramalapariyuṭṭhitāya pajāya vigatamalamaccherena cetasā agāraṁ ajjhāvasāmi muttacāgo payatapāṇi vossaggarato yācayogo dānasaṁvibhāgarato’ti.
analyzed: yaḥ ham macchera mala pariyuṭṭhitāya pajāya vigata mala maccherena cetasā agāram ajjhāvasāmi mutta cāgaḥ payata pāṇi vossagga rataḥ yāca yogaḥ dāna savibhāga rataḥ iti
translated: ‘It is a gain for me, it is a great gain for me, that in a generation tainted by stinginess, I live the home life in renunciation, freely generous, open-handed, loving to let go, committed to charity, loving to give and to share.’

original: Yasmiṁ, mahānāma, samaye ariyasāvako cāgaṁ anussarati, nevassa tasmiṁ samaye rāgapariyuṭṭhitaṁ cittaṁ hoti, na dosapariyuṭṭhitaṁ cittaṁ hoti, na mohapariyuṭṭhitaṁ cittaṁ hoti;
analyzed: yasmi mahānāma samaye ariya sāvakaḥ cāgam anussarati na iva assa tasmin samaye rāga pariyuṭṭhitam cittam hoti na dosa pariyuṭṭhitam cittam hoti na moha pariyuṭṭhitam cittam hoti
translated: “When a noble disciple recollects the generosity of the noble ones, on that occasion his mind is not obsessed by lust, hatred, or delusion; on that occasion his mind is simply straight.

original: ujugatamevassa tasmiṁ samaye cittaṁ hoti cāgaṁ ārabbha.
analyzed: uju gatam eva assa tasmin samaye cittam hoti cāgam ārabbha
translated: “When the mind is straight, the mind is said to be made straight.

original: Ujugatacitto kho pana, mahānāma, ariyasāvako labhati atthavedaṁ, labhati dhammavedaṁ, labhati dhammūpasaṁhitaṁ pāmojjaṁ.🔽Pamuditassa pīti jāyati, pītimanassa kāyo passambhati, passaddhakāyo sukhaṁ vediyati, sukhino cittaṁ samādhiyati.
analyzed: ujugatacittaḥ kho pana mahā nāma ariya sāvakaḥ labhati attha veda labhati dhamma veda labhati dhamma upasahitam pāmojja  pamuditassa pīti jāyati pīti manassa kāyo passambhati passaddha kāyo sukham vediyati sukhinaḥ cittam samādhiyati
translated: When the mind is rightly concentrated, Mahanama, a noble disciple gains insight into things as they really are. He gains joy connected with the Dhamma.🔽When he is joyful, rapture arises. When the mind is uplifted by rapture, the body becomes tranquil. One tranquil in body experiences happiness. The mind of one who is happy becomes concentrated.

original: Ayaṁ vuccati, mahānāma, ariyasāvako visamagatāya pajāya samappatto viharati, sabyāpajjāya pajāya abyāpajjo viharati, dhammasotasamāpanno cāgānussatiṁ bhāveti.
analyzed: ayam vuccati mahānāma ariya sāvako visama gatāya pajāya samappattaḥ viharati sa byāpajjāya pajāya a byāpajjaḥ viharati dhamma sota samāpannaḥ cāga anussatim bhāveti
translated: This, Mahanama, is called a noble disciple who, with the destruction of the five lower fetters, is one who attains final knowledge early in this very life.

original: Puna caparaṁ tvaṁ, mahānāma, devatā anussareyyāsi:
analyzed: puna caparam tva mahānāma devatāḥ anussareyyāsi
translated: “Again, Mahanama, you should recollect the gods thus:

original: ‘santi devā cātumahārājikā, santi devā tāvatiṁsā, santi devā yāmā, santi devā tusitā,
analyzed: santi devā cātumahārājikā santi devā santi devā santi devā
translated: ‘There are the gods of the heaven of the Four Great Kings, the gods of the heaven of the Thirty-three, the Yama gods, the gods of the Tusita heaven,

original: santi devā nimmānaratino, santi devā paranimmitavasavattino, santi devā brahmakāyikā,🔽santi devā tatuttari.
analyzed: santi devā nimmāna ratinaḥ santi devā paranimmitavasavattinaḥ santi devā brahmakāyikā 🔽santi devā tatuttari
translated: the gods who delight in creating, the gods who wield power over others’ creations, and the gods in the Brahma-world.

original: Yathārūpāya saddhāya samannāgatā tā devatā ito cutā tatthūpapannā, mayhampi tathārūpā saddhā saṁvijjati.
analyzed: yathārūpāya saddhāya samannāgatā tāḥ devatāḥ itas cutā tatthu upapannā mayham pi tathārūpā saddhā savijjati
translated: Those deities, who had such faith as that, passed away here and were reborn there. I too have such faith as that.

original: Yathārūpena sīlena samannāgatā tā devatā ito cutā tatthūpapannā, mayhampi tathārūpaṁ sīlaṁ saṁvijjati.🔽Yathārūpena sutena samannāgatā tā devatā ito cutā tatthūpapannā, mayhampi tathārūpaṁ sutaṁ saṁvijjati.
analyzed: yathārūpena sīlena samannāgatā tāḥ devatāḥ itas cutā tatthu upapannā mayham pi tathārūpam sīlam savijjati  yathārūpena sutena samannāgatā tāḥ devatāḥ itas cutā tatthu upapannā mayham pi tathārūpam sutam savijjati
translated: ‘Those deities who, endowed with such faith, virtue,🔽learning, generosity, and wisdom, passed away

original: Yathārūpena cāgena samannāgatā tā devatā ito cutā tatthūpapannā, mayhampi tathārūpo cāgo saṁvijjati.
analyzed: yathārūpena cāgena samannāgatā tāḥ devatāḥ itas cutā tatthu upapannā mayham pi tathārūpaḥ cāgo savijjati
translated: from there to be reborn here have the same faith, virtue,

original: Yathārūpāya paññāya samannāgatā tā devatā ito cutā tatthūpapannā, mayhampi tathārūpā paññā saṁvijjatī’ti.
analyzed: yathārūpāya paññāya samannāgatā tāḥ devatāḥ itas cutā tatthu upapannā mayham pi tathārūpā paññā savijjati iti
translated: learning, generosity, and wisdom that I have.’

original: Yasmiṁ, mahānāma, samaye ariyasāvako attano ca tāsañca devatānaṁ saddhañca sīlañca
analyzed: yasmi mahānāma samaye ariya sāvakaḥ ca tāsam ca devatānam saddham ca sīlam ca
translated: “Mahanama, when a noble disciple recollects the faith, the virtue,🔽the learning, the generosity, and the wisdom that are both his and those deities’,

original: sutañca cāgañca paññañca anussarati, nevassa tasmiṁ samaye rāgapariyuṭṭhitaṁ cittaṁ
analyzed: sutam ca cāgam ca paññam ca anussarati na iva assa tasmin samaye rāga pariyuṭṭhitam citta
translated: on that occasion his mind is not obsessed by lust,🔽not obsessed by hatred,🔽not obsessed by delusion;

original: hoti, na dosapariyuṭṭhitaṁ cittaṁ hoti, na mohapariyuṭṭhitaṁ cittaṁ hoti;🔽ujugatamevassa tasmiṁ samaye cittaṁ hoti devatā ārabbha.
analyzed: hoti na dosa pariyuṭṭhitam cittam hoti na moha pariyuṭṭhitam cittam hoti  uju gatam eva assa tasmin samaye cittam hoti devatāḥ ārabbha
translated: His mind is not overcome with hate, his mind is not overcome with delusion.🔽On that occasion his mind is rightly concentrated in jhāna, in a state of composure that is free from thinking and pondering.

original: Ujugatacitto kho pana, mahānāma, ariyasāvako labhati atthavedaṁ, labhati dhammavedaṁ, labhati dhammūpasaṁhitaṁ pāmojjaṁ.
analyzed: ujugatacittaḥ kho pana mahā nāma ariya sāvakaḥ labhati attha veda labhati dhamma veda labhati dhamma upasahitam pāmojja
translated: When the mind is rightly concentrated in jhāna, in a state of composure that is free from thinking and pondering, a noble disciple gains knowledge and vision externally of the devas.

original: Pamuditassa pīti jāyati, pītimanassa kāyo passambhati, passaddhakāyo sukhaṁ vediyati, sukhino cittaṁ samādhiyati.
analyzed: pamuditassa pīti jāyati pīti manassa kāyo passambhati passaddha kāyo sukham vediyati sukhinaḥ cittam samādhiyati
translated: When he is joyful, rapture arises. When the mind is uplifted by rapture, the body becomes tranquil. One tranquil in body experiences happiness. The mind of one who is happy becomes concentrated.

original: Ayaṁ vuccati, mahānāma, ariyasāvako visamagatāya pajāya samappatto viharati, sabyāpajjāya pajāya abyāpajjo viharati, dhammasotasamāpanno devatānussatiṁ bhāvetī”ti.🔽Paṭhamaṁ.
analyzed: ayam vuccati mahānāma ariya sāvakaḥ visama gatāya pajāya samappattaḥ viharati sa byāpajjāya pajāya a byāpajjaḥ viharati dhamma sota samāpannaḥ devatā anussatim bhāveti iti  paṭhama
translated: This, Mahanama, is called a noble disciple who, with the destruction of the five lower fetters, is due to reappear spontaneously in the Pure Abodes and there attain final Nibbana, without ever returning from that world.”🔽First: With the Destruction of the Five Lower Fetters

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 11.12
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The Book of the Fives

original: 2. Anussativagga
analyzed: anussati vagga
translated: The Chapter on Recollection

original: Dutiyamahānāmasutta
analyzed: dutiya mahānāma sutta
translated: With Mahanama (The Second Portion for Recital)

original: Ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sakkesu viharati kapilavatthusmiṁ nigrodhārāme.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā sakkesu viharati kapilavatthusmin nigrodha ārāme
translated: At one time the Blessed One was dwelling among the Sakyans at Kapilavatthu in Nigrodha’s Park.

original: Tena kho pana samayena mahānāmo sakko gilānā vuṭṭhito hoti aciravuṭṭhito gelaññā.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena mahānāmaḥ sakkaḥ gilānā vuṭṭhitaḥ hoti acira vuṭṭhitaḥ gelaññā
translated: At that time Mahānāma the Sakyan had recently recovered from illness.

original: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū bhagavato cīvarakammaṁ karonti:
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena sambahulāḥ bhikkhū bhagavataḥ cīvara kammam karonti
translated: At that time a number of monks were making robes for the Buddha, thinking,

original: “niṭṭhitacīvaro bhagavā temāsaccayena cārikaṁ pakkamissatī”ti.
analyzed: niṭṭhita cīvaraḥ bhagavā te māsa cayena cārikam pakkamissati iti
translated: “When his robe is finished, the Buddha will set out on tour after three months.”

original: Assosi kho mahānāmo sakko:
analyzed: assosi kho mahānāmaḥ sakko
translated: Mahānāma heard

original: “sambahulā kira bhikkhū bhagavato cīvarakammaṁ karonti:
analyzed: sambahulā kira bhikkhū bhagavataḥ cīvara kammam karonti
translated: that a number of monks were making robes for the Buddha, thinking,

original: ‘niṭṭhitacīvaro bhagavā temāsaccayena cārikaṁ pakkamissatī’”ti.
analyzed: niṭṭhita cīvaraḥ bhagavā te māsa cayena cārikam pakkamissati iti
translated: “When his robe is finished, the Buddha will set out on tour after three months.”

original: Atha kho mahānāmo sakko yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho mahānāmo sakko bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu mahānāmaḥ sakkaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ khalu mahānāmaḥ sakkaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: He then went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down, and said,

original: “sutaṁ metaṁ, bhante:
analyzed: sutam mā ita bhante
translated: “Sir, I heard

original: ‘sambahulā kira bhikkhū bhagavato cīvarakammaṁ karonti—
analyzed: sambahulā kira bhikkhū bhagavataḥ cīvara kammam karonti
translated: that a number of monks are making robes for the Buddha, thinking,

original: niṭṭhitacīvaro bhagavā temāsaccayena cārikaṁ pakkamissatī’ti.
analyzed: niṭṭhita cīvaraḥ bhagavā te māsa cayena cārikam pakkamissati iti
translated: ‘When his robe is finished, the Buddha will set out on tour after three months.’

original: Tesaṁ no, bhante, nānāvihārehi viharataṁ kenassa vihārena vihātabban”ti?
analyzed: tesam naḥ bhante nānā vihārehi viharatam kenassa vihārena vihātabbanti
translated: Since we live in different dwellings, which one should we live in?”

original: “Sādhu sādhu, mahānāma.
analyzed: sādhu sādhu mahānāma
translated: “Good, good, Mahanama!

original: Etaṁ kho, mahānāma, tumhākaṁ patirūpaṁ kulaputtānaṁ yaṁ tumhe tathāgataṁ upasaṅkamitvā puccheyyātha:
analyzed: etam kho mahānāma tumhākam pati rūpam kula puttānam yam tumhe tathāgatam upasaṅkamitvā puccheyyātha
translated: It’s proper for you clansmen to come to the Buddha and ask:

original: ‘tesaṁ no, bhante, nānāvihārehi viharataṁ kenassa vihārena vihātabban’ti?🔽Saddho kho, mahānāma, ārādhako hoti, no assaddho;
analyzed: tesam naḥ bhante nānā vihārehi viharatam kenassa vihārena vihātabbanti  saddhaḥ kho mahānāma ārādhakaḥ hoti no assaddhaḥ
translated: ‘Since we live in different dwellings, which one should we live in?’🔽One with faith succeeds, not one without faith.

original: āraddhavīriyo ārādhako hoti, no kusīto;🔽upaṭṭhitassati ārādhako hoti, no muṭṭhassati;
analyzed: āraddha vīriyaḥ ārādhako hoti no kusīto  upaṭṭhitassati ārādhakaḥ hoti no muṭṭhassati
translated: One with energy succeeds, not one without energy.🔽One with mindfulness succeeds, not one without mindfulness.

original: samāhito ārādhako hoti, no asamāhito;
analyzed: samāhitaḥ ārādhakaḥ hoti no a samāhitaḥ
translated: One with concentration succeeds, not one without concentration.

original: paññavā ārādhako hoti, no duppañño.
analyzed: paññavā ārādhakaḥ hoti no duppaññaḥ
translated: One with wisdom succeeds, not one without wisdom.

original: Imesu kho tvaṁ, mahānāma, pañcasu dhammesu patiṭṭhāya cha dhamme uttari bhāveyyāsi.
analyzed: imesu kho tva mahānāma pañcasu dhammesu patiṭṭhāya cha dhamme uttari bhāveyyāsi
translated: Having established yourself in these five qualities, you should further develop six things.

original: Idha tvaṁ, mahānāma, tathāgataṁ anussareyyāsi:
analyzed: idha tva mahānāma tathāgatam anussareyyāsi
translated: Here, Mahanama, you should recollect the Buddha:

original: ‘itipi so bhagavā …pe… satthā devamanussānaṁ buddho bhagavā’ti.
analyzed: iti pi saḥ bhagavā pe satthā deva manussānam buddhaḥ bhagavā ati
translated: ‘That Blessed One is such since he is accomplished, fully enlightened, endowed with vision and conduct, sublime, the knower of worlds, the incomparable leader of persons to be tamed, the teacher of gods and humans, enlightened, blessed.’

original: Yasmiṁ, mahānāma, samaye ariyasāvako tathāgataṁ anussarati, nevassa tasmiṁ samaye rāgapariyuṭṭhitaṁ cittaṁ hoti, na dosapariyuṭṭhitaṁ cittaṁ hoti, na mohapariyuṭṭhitaṁ cittaṁ hoti;
analyzed: yasmi mahānāma samaye ariya sāvakaḥ tathāgatam anussarati na iva assa tasmin samaye rāga pariyuṭṭhitam cittam hoti na dosa pariyuṭṭhitam cittam hoti na moha pariyuṭṭhitam cittam hoti
translated: “Mahanama, when a noble disciple recollects the Tathagata, on that occasion his mind is not obsessed by lust, his mind is not obsessed by hatred, his mind is not obsessed by delusion;

original: ujugatamevassa tasmiṁ samaye cittaṁ hoti tathāgataṁ ārabbha.
analyzed: uju gatam eva assa tasmin samaye cittam hoti tathāgatam ārabbha
translated: his mind heads straight, based on the Tathagata.

original: Ujugatacitto kho pana, mahānāma, ariyasāvako labhati atthavedaṁ, labhati dhammavedaṁ, labhati dhammūpasaṁhitaṁ pāmojjaṁ.
analyzed: ujugatacittaḥ kho pana mahā nāma ariya sāvakaḥ labhati attha veda labhati dhamma veda labhati dhamma upasahitam pāmojja
translated: “On that occasion the noble disciple’s mind is rightly concentrated in what rightly leads to the abandoning of lust.

original: Pamuditassa pīti jāyati, pītimanassa kāyo passambhati, passaddhakāyo sukhaṁ vediyati, sukhino cittaṁ samādhiyati.
analyzed: pamuditassa pīti jāyati pīti manassa kāyo passambhati passaddha kāyo sukham vediyati sukhinaḥ cittam samādhiyati
translated: When the mind is rightly concentrated, a bhikkhu understands as it really is: ‘This is suffering’; he understands as it really is: ‘This is the origin of suffering’; he understands as it really is: ‘This is the cessation of suffering’; he understands as it really is: ‘This is the way leading to the cessation of suffering.’

original: Imaṁ kho tvaṁ, mahānāma, buddhānussatiṁ gacchantopi bhāveyyāsi, ṭhitopi bhāveyyāsi,
analyzed: imam kho tva mahā nāma buddha anussatim gacchantaḥ api bhāveyyāsi ṭhitaḥ api bhāveyyāsi
translated: “So, Mahanama, you should train thus: ‘I shall recollect the Buddha, the Dhamma, and the Sangha.’🔽“When you are undertaking some activity, Mahanama, you should train thus: ‘I shall recollect the Buddha, the Dhamma, and the Sangha.’

original: nisinnopi bhāveyyāsi, sayānopi bhāveyyāsi, kammantaṁ adhiṭṭhahantopi bhāveyyāsi,🔽puttasambādhasayanaṁ ajjhāvasantopi bhāveyyāsi.
analyzed: nisinnaḥ api bhāveyyāsi sa yānaḥ api bhāveyyāsi kammantam adhiṭṭhahantaḥ api bhāveyyāsi 🔽putta sambādha sayanam ajjhāvasantaḥ api bhāveyyāsi
translated: “When you are living in a home filled with children, you should train thus: ‘I shall recollect the Buddha, the Dhamma, and the Sangha.’

original: Puna caparaṁ tvaṁ, mahānāma, dhammaṁ anussareyyāsi …pe…🔽saṅghaṁ anussareyyāsi …pe…🔽attano sīlaṁ anussareyyāsi …pe…
analyzed: puna caparam tva mahānāma dhammaṃ anussareyyāsi pe  saṅgham anussareyyāsi pe  attanaḥ sīlam anussareyyāsi pe
translated: You should recollect the Dhamma …🔽the Sangha …🔽your own virtue …

original: attano cāgaṁ anussareyyāsi …pe…
analyzed: attano cāgam anussareyyāsi pe
translated: your own generosity …

original: devatā anussareyyāsi:🔽‘santi devā cātumahārājikā …pe… santi devā tatuttari.
analyzed: devatāḥ anussareyyāsi  santi devā cātumahārājikā pe santi devā tatuttari
translated: You should recollect the deities thus:🔽‘There are the gods of the heaven of the Four Great Kings … there are gods of the heaven of the Thirty-three … there are gods of the Yama heaven … there are gods of the Contented heaven … there are gods of the heaven of Radiance … there are gods of the heaven of Limited Radiance … there are gods of the heaven of Immeasurable Radiance … there are gods of the heaven of Streaming Radiance … there are gods of the heaven of Glory … there are gods of the heaven of Limited Glory … there are gods of the heaven of Immeasurable Glory … there are gods of the heaven of Streaming Glory … there are gods of the heaven of Great Fruit … there are gods of the Aviha heaven … there are gods of the Atappa heaven … there are gods of the Sudassa heaven … there are gods of the Sudassī heaven … there are gods of the Akaniṭṭha heaven.

original: Yathārūpāya saddhāya samannāgatā tā devatā ito cutā tatthūpapannā, mayhampi tathārūpā saddhā saṁvijjati.
analyzed: yathārūpāya saddhāya samannāgatā tāḥ devatāḥ itas cutā tatthu upapannā mayham pi tathārūpā saddhā savijjati
translated: Those deities, having been endowed with such faith,🔽such virtue,🔽such learning,

original: Yathārūpena sīlena …
analyzed: yathārūpena sīlena
translated: such generosity,🔽such wisdom, on the dissolution of the body, after death, have reappeared in a happy destiny, in the heavenly world.

original: sutena …
analyzed: sutena
translated: And I too possess such faith …🔽such virtue …🔽such learning …

original: cāgena …
analyzed: cāgena
translated: such generosity …

original: paññāya samannāgatā tā devatā ito cutā tatthūpapannā, mayhampi tathārūpā paññā saṁvijjatī’ti.🔽Yasmiṁ, mahānāma, samaye ariyasāvako attano ca tāsañca devatānaṁ saddhañca sīlañca
analyzed: paññāya samannāgatā tāḥ devatāḥ itas cutā tatthu upapannā mayham pi tathārūpā paññā savijjati iti  yasmi mahānāma samaye ariya sāvakaḥ ca tāsam ca devatānam saddham ca sīlam ca
translated: such wisdom.’

original: sutañca cāgañca paññañca anussarati, nevassa tasmiṁ samaye rāgapariyuṭṭhitaṁ cittaṁ
analyzed: sutam ca cāgam ca paññam ca anussarati na iva assa tasmin samaye rāga pariyuṭṭhitam citta
translated: “Mahanama, when a noble disciple recollects the faith, the virtue, the learning, the generosity, and the wisdom that were his, and that were those deities’, his mind does not incline to ardour, devotion, perseverance, and striving.

original: hoti, na dosapariyuṭṭhitaṁ cittaṁ hoti, na mohapariyuṭṭhitaṁ cittaṁ hoti;
analyzed: hoti na dosa pariyuṭṭhitam cittam hoti na moha pariyuṭṭhitam cittam hoti
translated: His mind is not overcome with hate, his mind is not overcome with delusion.

original: ujugatamevassa tasmiṁ samaye cittaṁ hoti devatā ārabbha.
analyzed: uju gatam eva assa tasmin samaye cittam hoti devatāḥ ārabbha
translated: On that occasion his mind is rightly concentrated in jhāna, in a state of composure.

original: Ujugatacitto kho pana, mahānāma, ariyasāvako labhati atthavedaṁ, labhati dhammavedaṁ, labhati dhammūpasaṁhitaṁ pāmojjaṁ.
analyzed: ujugatacittaḥ kho pana mahā nāma ariya sāvakaḥ labhati attha veda labhati dhamma veda labhati dhamma upasahitam pāmojja
translated: A noble disciple who has a mind rightly concentrated in jhāna, in a state of composure, gains inspiration in the meaning, gains inspiration in the Dhamma, gains joy connected with the Dhamma.

original: Pamuditassa pīti jāyati, pītimanassa kāyo passambhati, passaddhakāyo sukhaṁ vediyati, sukhino cittaṁ samādhiyati.🔽Imaṁ kho tvaṁ, mahānāma, devatānussatiṁ gacchantopi bhāveyyāsi, ṭhitopi bhāveyyāsi,
analyzed: pamuditassa pīti jāyati pīti manassa kāyo passambhati passaddha kāyo sukham vediyati sukhinaḥ cittam samādhiyati  imam kho tva mahā nāma devatā anussatim gacchantaḥ api bhāveyyāsi ṭhitaḥ api bhāveyyāsi
translated: When one has such joy, rapture arises. When the mind is uplifted by rapture, the body becomes tranquil. One tranquil in body experiences happiness. The mind of one who is happy becomes concentrated.

original: nisinnopi bhāveyyāsi, sayānopi bhāveyyāsi, kammantaṁ adhiṭṭhahantopi bhāveyyāsi,
analyzed: nisinnaḥ api bhāveyyāsi sa yānaḥ api bhāveyyāsi kammantam adhiṭṭhahantaḥ api bhāveyyāsi
translated: “Mahānāma, while walking, you should develop the recollection of the deities; while standing, you should develop the recollection of the deities; while sitting, you should develop the recollection of the deities; while in bed, you should develop the recollection of the deities; while in the village or the forest, you should develop the recollection of the deities; while in motion or at rest, you should develop the recollection of the deities.

original: puttasambādhasayanaṁ ajjhāvasantopi bhāveyyāsī”ti.🔽Dutiyaṁ.🔽Aṅguttara Nikāya 11.13
analyzed: putta sambādha sayanam ajjhāvasantaḥ api bhāveyyāsi iti  dutiya  aṅguttara nikāya
translated: You should develop the recollection of the deities thus: ‘The deities are happy, joyful, and free from distress.’🔽This is the second section for recitation.🔽The Book of the Elevens

original: 2. Anussativagga
analyzed: anussati vagga
translated: The Chapter on Recollection

original: Nandiyasutta
analyzed: nandiyasutta
translated: With Nandiya

original: Ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sakkesu viharati kapilavatthusmiṁ nigrodhārāme.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā sakkesu viharati kapilavatthusmin nigrodha ārāme
translated: At one time the Buddha was staying in the Sakyan country, near Kapilavatthu in the Banyan Tree Monastery.

original: Tena kho pana samayena bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ vassāvāsaṁ upagantukāmo hoti.
analyzed: tena khaḥ pana samayena bhagavā sāvatthiyam vassa āvāsam upagantu kāmaḥ hoti
translated: On that occasion the Buddha wanted to spend the rainy season residence at Sāvatthī.

original: Assosi kho nandiyo sakko:
analyzed: assosi kho nandiyaḥ sakko
translated: The Sakyan Nandiya heard about this.

original: “bhagavā kira sāvatthiyaṁ vassāvāsaṁ upagantukāmo”ti.🔽Atha kho nandiyassa sakkassa etadahosi:
analyzed: bhagavā kira sāvatthiyam vassa āvāsam upagantu kāmaḥ iti  atha kho nandiyassa sakkassa etat ahosi
translated: He thought, “The Buddha wants to spend the rainy season residence at Sāvatthī.

original: “yannūnāhampi sāvatthiyaṁ vassāvāsaṁ upagaccheyyaṁ.
analyzed: yat nūna aham pi sāvatthiyam vassa āvāsam upagaccheyya
translated: Why don’t I also spend the rainy season residence at Sāvatthī?

original: Tattha kammantañceva adhiṭṭhahissāmi, bhagavantañca lacchāmi kālena kālaṁ dassanāyā”ti.
analyzed: tattha kammantam ca iva adhiṭṭhahissāmi bhagavantam ca lacchāmi kālena kālam dassanāya ati
translated: I’ll do my work there and I’ll be able to see the Buddha from time to time.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ vassāvāsaṁ upagacchi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā sāvatthiyam vassa āvāsam upagacchi
translated: And the Buddha spent the rainy season residence at Sāvatthī.

original: Nandiyopi kho sakko sāvatthiyaṁ vassāvāsaṁ upagacchi.
analyzed: nandiyaḥ api kho sakkaḥ sāvatthiyam vassa āvāsam upagacchi
translated: Nandiya did the same.

original: Tattha kammantañceva adhiṭṭhāsi, bhagavantañca labhi kālena kālaṁ dassanāya.
analyzed: tattha bhagavantam ca labhi kālena kālam dassanāya
translated: He did his work there and he was able to see the Buddha from time to time.

original: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū bhagavato cīvarakammaṁ karonti:
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena sambahulāḥ bhikkhū bhagavataḥ cīvara kammam karonti
translated: On that occasion a number of monks were making a robe for the Buddha, thinking,

original: “niṭṭhitacīvaro bhagavā temāsaccayena cārikaṁ pakkamissatī”ti.
analyzed: niṭṭhita cīvaraḥ bhagavā te māsa cayena cārikam pakkamissati iti
translated: “The Buddha’s robe is finished. At the end of three months he’ll set out wandering.”

original: Assosi kho nandiyo sakko:
analyzed: assosi kho nandiyaḥ sakko
translated: Nandiya heard

original: “sambahulā kira bhikkhū bhagavato cīvarakammaṁ karonti:
analyzed: sambahulā kira bhikkhū bhagavataḥ cīvara kammam karonti
translated: that a number of monks were making a robe for the Buddha,

original: ‘niṭṭhitacīvaro bhagavā temāsaccayena cārikaṁ pakkamissatī’”ti.
analyzed: niṭṭhita cīvaraḥ bhagavā te māsa cayena cārikam pakkamissati iti
translated: saying, “The Buddha’s robe is finished. At the end of three months he’ll set out wandering.”🔽He then went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

original: Atha kho nandiyo sakko yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho nandiyo sakko bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu nandiyaḥ sakkaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ khalu nandiyaḥ sakkaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: and said,

original: “sutaṁ metaṁ, bhante:
analyzed: sutam mā ita bhante
translated: “Sir, I heard

original: ‘sambahulā kira bhikkhū bhagavato cīvarakammaṁ karonti—
analyzed: sambahulā kira bhikkhū bhagavataḥ cīvara kammam karonti
translated: that a number of monks are making a robe for the Buddha,

original: niṭṭhitacīvaro bhagavā temāsaccayena cārikaṁ pakkamissatī’ti.
analyzed: niṭṭhita cīvaraḥ bhagavā te māsa cayena cārikam pakkamissati iti
translated: saying, ‘The Buddha’s robe is finished. At the end of three months he’ll set out wandering.’

original: Tesaṁ no, bhante, nānāvihārehi viharataṁ kenassa vihārena vihātabban”ti?
analyzed: tesam naḥ bhante nānā vihārehi viharatam kenassa vihārena vihātabbanti
translated: Since we live in different dwellings, which dwelling should we use?”

original: “Sādhu sādhu, nandiya.
analyzed: sādhu sādhu nandiya
translated: “Good, good, Nandiya!

original: Etaṁ kho, nandiya, tumhākaṁ patirūpaṁ kulaputtānaṁ, yaṁ tumhe tathāgataṁ upasaṅkamitvā puccheyyātha:
analyzed: etam khalu nandiya tumhākam pati rūpam kula puttāna yam tumhe tathāgatam upasaṅkamitvā puccheyyātha
translated: It is proper for you clansmen to come to the Tathagata and ask:

original: ‘tesaṁ no, bhante, nānāvihārehi viharataṁ kenassa vihārena vihātabban’ti?
analyzed: tesam naḥ bhante nānā vihārehi viharatam kenassa vihārena vihātabbanti
translated: ‘Venerable sir, which is the best dwelling?’

original: Saddho kho, nandiya, ārādhako hoti, no assaddho;🔽sīlavā ārādhako hoti, no dussīlo;
analyzed: saddhaḥ kho nandiyaḥ ārādhakaḥ hoti no assaddhaḥ  sīlavān ārādhakaḥ hoti no dussīlaḥ
translated: “Nandiya, one who has faith is successful, not one who is faithless.🔽One who is virtuous is successful, not one who is immoral.

original: āraddhavīriyo ārādhako hoti, no kusīto;🔽upaṭṭhitassati ārādhako hoti, no muṭṭhassati;
analyzed: āraddha vīriyaḥ ārādhako hoti no kusīto  upaṭṭhitassati ārādhakaḥ hoti no muṭṭhassati
translated: One who is energetic is successful, not one who is lazy.🔽One who is mindful is successful, not one who is unmindful.

original: samāhito ārādhako hoti, no asamāhito;
analyzed: samāhitaḥ ārādhakaḥ hoti no a samāhitaḥ
translated: One who is concentrated is successful, not one who is unconcentrated.

original: paññavā ārādhako hoti, no duppañño.🔽Imesu kho te, nandiya, chasu dhammesu patiṭṭhāya pañcasu dhammesu ajjhattaṁ sati upaṭṭhāpetabbā.
analyzed: paññavā ārādhakaḥ hoti no duppaññaḥ  imesu kho te nandiya chasu dhammesu patiṭṭhāya pañcasu dhammesu ajjhattam sati upaṭṭhāpetabbā
translated: One who is wise is successful, not one who is unwise.

original: Idha tvaṁ, nandiya, tathāgataṁ anussareyyāsi:
analyzed: idha tva nandiya tathāgatam anussareyyāsi
translated: “Nandiya, when you are established in these six things, you should further establish mindfulness internally as follows:

original: ‘itipi so bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi, satthā devamanussānaṁ buddho bhagavā’ti.
analyzed: iti pi saḥ bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ vijjā caraṇa sampanno sugataḥ loka vidū anuttaraḥ purisa damma sārathi satthā deva manussānam buddhaḥ bhagavā ati
translated: ‘The Blessed Lord is accomplished, fully enlightened, perfect in true knowledge and conduct, sublime, knower of worlds, incomparable leader of persons to be tamed, teacher of gods and humans, enlightened, blessed.’

original: Iti kho te, nandiya, tathāgataṁ ārabbha ajjhattaṁ sati upaṭṭhāpetabbā.
analyzed: iti kho te nandiya tathāgatam ārabbha ajjhattam sati upaṭṭhāpetabbā
translated: In this way, Nandiya, you can establish mindfulness with regard to the Tathagata.

original: Puna caparaṁ tvaṁ, nandiya, dhammaṁ anussareyyāsi:
analyzed: puna caparam tva nandiya dhammaṃ anussareyyāsi
translated: ‘Again, Nandiya, you can establish mindfulness by thinking:

original: ‘svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo sandiṭṭhiko akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṁ veditabbo viññūhī’ti.
analyzed: su ākkhātaḥ bhagavatā dhammaḥ sandiṭṭhikaḥ akālikaḥ ehipassikaḥ opaneyyikaḥ paccattam veditabbaḥ viññūhi iti
translated: “The Dhamma is well proclaimed by the Blessed Lord, visible here and now, timeless, inviting inspection, leading onward, to be comprehended by the wise each one for himself.”

original: Iti kho te, nandiya, dhammaṁ ārabbha ajjhattaṁ sati upaṭṭhāpetabbā.
analyzed: iti kho te nandiya dhammam ārabbha ajjhattam sati upaṭṭhāpetabbā
translated: In this way, Nandiya, you can establish mindfulness with regard to the Dhamma.

original: Puna caparaṁ tvaṁ, nandiya, kalyāṇamitte anussareyyāsi:🔽‘lābhā vata me, suladdhaṁ vata me,
analyzed: puna caparam tva nandiya kalyāṇa mitte anussareyyāsi  lābhāḥ vata me su laddham vata me
translated: ‘Again, Nandiya, you can establish mindfulness by thinking:

original: yassa me kalyāṇamittā anukampakā atthakāmā ovādakā anusāsakā’ti.
analyzed: yassa me kalyāṇa mittāḥ anukampakāḥ attha kāmāḥ ovādakāḥ anusāsakā ati
translated: “It is a gain for me that I have such and such noble friends and companions!”

original: Iti kho te, nandiya, kalyāṇamitte ārabbha ajjhattaṁ sati upaṭṭhāpetabbā.
analyzed: iti kho te nandiya kalyāṇa mitte ārabbha ajjhattam sati upaṭṭhāpetabbā
translated: In this way, Nandiya, you can establish mindfulness with regard to your noble friends.

original: Puna caparaṁ tvaṁ, nandiya, attano cāgaṁ anussareyyāsi:
analyzed: puna caparam tva nandiya attano cāgam anussareyyāsi
translated: Furthermore, Nandiya, you should recollect your own generosity:

original: ‘lābhā vata me, suladdhaṁ vata me,
analyzed: lābhāḥ vata me su laddham vata me
translated: ‘It is a gain for me, it is a great gain for me,

original: yohaṁ maccheramalapariyuṭṭhitāya pajāya vigatamalamaccherena cetasā agāraṁ ajjhāvasāmi muttacāgo payatapāṇi vossaggarato yācayogo dānasaṁvibhāgarato’ti.
analyzed: yaḥ ham macchera mala pariyuṭṭhitāya pajāya vigata mala maccherena cetasā agāram ajjhāvasāmi mutta cāgaḥ payata pāṇi vossagga rataḥ yāca yogaḥ dāna savibhāga rataḥ iti
translated: that in a generation obsessed by the stain of stinginess, I live at home, my mind devoid of the stain of stinginess, freely generous, open-handed, loving to let go, committed to charity, loving to give and to share.’

original: Iti kho te, nandiya, cāgaṁ ārabbha ajjhattaṁ sati upaṭṭhāpetabbā.
analyzed: iti kho te nandiya cāgam ārabbha ajjhattam sati upaṭṭhāpetabbā
translated: In this way, Nandiya, you should establish mindfulness directed to the body.

original: Puna caparaṁ tvaṁ, nandiya, devatā anussareyyāsi:
analyzed: puna caparam tva nandiya devatāḥ anussareyyāsi
translated: Furthermore, Nandiya, you should recollect the deities:

original: ‘yā devatā atikkammeva kabaḷīkārāhārabhakkhānaṁ devatānaṁ sahabyataṁ aññataraṁ manomayaṁ kāyaṁ upapannā, tā karaṇīyaṁ attano na samanupassanti katassa vā paticayaṁ’.
analyzed: yāḥ devatāḥ atikkamma iva kabaḷīkāra āhāra bhakkhānam devatānam sahabyatam aññataram manaḥ mayam kāyam upapannā tāḥ karaṇīyam attanaḥ na samanupassanti katassa vā
translated: ‘There are the deities of the realm of the Four Great Kings…

original: Seyyathāpi, nandiya, bhikkhu asamayavimutto karaṇīyaṁ attano na samanupassati katassa vā paticayaṁ;
analyzed: seyyathā api nandiya bhikkhu a samaya vimuttaḥ karaṇīyam attanaḥ na samanupassati katassa vā
translated: Just as a bhikkhu liberated by wisdom, having seen with wisdom, would not expect to see further,

original: evamevaṁ kho, nandiya, yā tā devatā atikkammeva kabaḷīkārāhārabhakkhānaṁ devatānaṁ
analyzed: evam evam kho nandiya yāḥ tāḥ devatāḥ atikkamma iva kabaḷīkāra āhāra bhakkhānam
translated: So too, Nandiya, there are deities who, with the complete transcendence of perceptions of form,🔽with the disappearance of perceptions of sensory impact, with non-attention to perceptions of diversity, aware that ‘space is infinite,’

original: sahabyataṁ aññataraṁ manomayaṁ kāyaṁ upapannā, tā karaṇīyaṁ attano na samanupassanti🔽katassa vā paticayaṁ.
analyzed: sahabyatam aññataram manaḥ mayam kāyam upapannā tā karaṇīyam attanaḥ na samanupassanti  katassa vā paticaya
translated: have passed on to the base of infinite space. They see no further need for anything else to be done.

original: Iti kho te, nandiya, devatā ārabbha ajjhattaṁ sati upaṭṭhāpetabbā.
analyzed: iti kho te nandiya devatāḥ ārabbha ajjhattam sati upaṭṭhāpetabbā
translated: So, Nandiya, you should develop mindfulness directed to the body to the extent that you will have some ground for knowing, some ground for seeing, some ground for realizing.

original: Imehi kho, nandiya, ekādasahi dhammehi samannāgato ariyasāvako pajahateva pāpake akusale dhamme, na upādiyati.
analyzed: imehi kho nandiyaḥ ekādasahi dhammehi samannāgataḥ ariya sāvako pajahatā iva pāpake akusale dhamme na upādiyati
translated: “Nandiya, a noble disciple who possesses these eleven qualities abandons evil unwholesome states of mind and does not grasp at anything in the world.

original: Seyyathāpi, nandiya, kumbho nikkujjo vamateva udakaṁ, no vantaṁ paccāvamati;🔽seyyathāpi vā pana, nandiya, sukkhe tiṇadāye aggi mutto ḍahaññeva gacchati, no daḍḍhaṁ paccudāvattati;
analyzed: seyyathā api nandiya kumbhaḥ nikkujjaḥ vamatā iva udaka no vantam paccāvamati  seyyathā api vā pana nandiya sukkhe tiṇa dāye aggi muttaḥ ḍahaññā iva gacchati no daḍḍham paccudāvattati
translated: Just as a pot turned upside down does not receive anything even though rain may fall,

original: evamevaṁ kho, nandiya, imehi ekādasahi dhammehi samannāgato ariyasāvako pajahateva pāpake akusale dhamme, na upādiyatī”ti.
analyzed: evam evam kho nandiya imehi ekādasahi dhammehi samannāgataḥ ariya sāvako pajahatā iva pāpake akusale dhamme na upādiyati iti
translated: so too, Nandiya, a noble disciple who possesses these eleven qualities abandons evil unwholesome states of mind and does not grasp at anything in the world.”

original: Tatiyaṁ.
analyzed: tatiya
translated: The third section for recitation is finished.

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 11.14
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya
translated: Numbered Discourses The One Who Has One Fortunate Quality The One Who Has One Fortunate Quality Translation: Aṅguttara Nikāya 11.14

original: 2. Anussativagga
analyzed: anussati vagga
translated: 1. Anussativagga

original: Subhūtisutta🔽Atha kho āyasmā subhūti saddhena bhikkhunā saddhiṁ yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā
analyzed: subhūti sutta  atha kho āyasmā subhūti saddhena bhikkhunā saddhim yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā
translated: Subhūtisutta

original: bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho āyasmantaṁ subhūtiṁ bhagavā etadavoca:
analyzed: bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnam kho āyasmantam subhūtim bhagavān etat avoca
translated: Then the venerable Subhuti went to the Buddha, the Blessed One, together with the monk Saddha. He bowed down to the Blessed One and sat to one side. The Blessed One said to him:

original: “ko nāmāyaṁ, subhūti, bhikkhū”ti?
analyzed: kaḥ nāmāya subhūti bhikkhu iti
translated: “Subhuti, what is the name of this monk?”

original: “Saddho nāmāyaṁ, bhante, bhikkhu, sudattassa upāsakassa putto, saddhā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito”ti.
analyzed: saddhaḥ nāmāya bhante bhikkhu sudattassa upāsakassa putto saddhā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajitoti
translated: “Venerable sir, this monk is called Saddha, the son of the lay follower Sudatta, who has gone forth out of faith from the home life into homelessness.”

original: “Kacci panāyaṁ, subhūti, saddho bhikkhu sudattassa upāsakassa putto saddhā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito sandissati saddhāpadānesū”ti?
analyzed: kacci pana āya subhūti saddhaḥ bhikkhu sudattassa upāsakassa putto saddhā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajitaḥ sandissati saddhā padānesu uti
translated: “But, Subhuti, does this monk Saddha, the son of the lay follower Sudatta, who has gone forth out of faith from the home life into homelessness, show himself in the ways of having faith?”

original: “Etassa, bhagavā, kālo; etassa, sugata, kālo,
analyzed: etassa bhagavā kālaḥ etassa sugata kālaḥ
translated: “Now is the time, Blessed One, now is the time, Sublime One,

original: yaṁ bhagavā saddhassa saddhāpadānāni bhāseyya.
analyzed: yam bhagavā saddhassa saddhā padānāni bhāseyya
translated: for the Blessed One to teach the ways of having faith.

original: Idānāhaṁ jānissāmi yadi vā ayaṁ bhikkhu sandissati saddhāpadānesu yadi vā no”ti.
analyzed: idānā aham jānissāmi yadi vā ayam bhikkhu sandissati saddhā apadānesu yadi vā no ti
translated: Then I will know whether this monk shows himself in the ways of having faith or not.”

original: “Tena hi, subhūti, suṇāhi, sādhukaṁ manasi karohi; bhāsissāmī”ti.
analyzed: tena hi subhūti suṇāhi sādhukam manasi karohi bhāsissāmi iti
translated: “Then listen and attend closely to what I shall say.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā subhūti bhagavato paccassosi.
analyzed: eva bhante iti kho āyasmā subhūti bhagavataḥ paccassosi
translated: “Yes, lord,” the venerable Subhuti replied.

original: Bhagavā etadavoca:
analyzed: bhagavān etat avoca
translated: The Blessed One said this:

original: “Idha, subhūti, bhikkhu sīlavā hoti, pātimokkhasaṁvarasaṁvuto viharati ācāragocarasampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī, samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu.
analyzed: idha subhūti bhikkhu sīlavā hoti pātimokkha savara savutaḥ viharati ācāra gocara sampannaḥ aṇumattesu vajjesu bhaya dassāvī samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu
translated: “Here, Subhuti, a bhikkhu is virtuous, he dwells restrained with the restraint of the Patimokkha, he is perfect in conduct and resort, and seeing fear in the slightest fault, he trains by undertaking the training precepts.

original: Yampi, subhūti, bhikkhu sīlavā hoti …pe… samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu, idampi, subhūti, saddhassa saddhāpadānaṁ hoti.
analyzed: yam pi subhūti bhikkhu sīlavā hoti pe samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu idam pi subhūti saddhassa saddhā apadānam hoti
